ygData.subject: Re: Out for the fun of it.

Wolfblade::

She opened her optics to look into his.  She smiled at him with all
the warmth in her spark. "Shhhh, don't talk about things now. Just now
that...no matter what, we will always be together, in battle, in base
camp. No matter where the Matrix takes us, I will be there." She
looked lovingly into his optics. Her optics flashed for a moment as
her protocol programs reminded her of something. "THE BOT! Oh no. I
forgot the mission we're on." She was still in his arms, but that look
of self frustration and mild self irritation at one that has let
themselves get caught up in the moment, showed on her face plates. She
looked up at him with a pink tint in her face plates. "Uh, well, erhm,
eh heh. Well, we can stay here a moment or two longer, but at some
point we still have to answer that beacon. Or else they'll send a
search party out for us too."  She kind of smirked at the thought.
"And I can imagine where they'd find us. Under a rock no doubt."  She
smiled up at him. "But then again, that may not be a bad thing." with
a slight chuckle. 





--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote:
> Malice::
>  
> He held her tight to him, parting with her felt like it would kill
him.  She parted her lips from his for a breif moment to tell him
something he already knew, that she loved him.  She then kissed him
harder than before, and he could only reciprocate again, words failing
his processors.  He tried to match her passion, putting all that he
was into the moment.  He parted his lips from hers breifly, his voice
a whisper as well.
>  
> "I love you too, and when we get back to base, I'm going to sort
this all out properly," he said, resting his forehead against hers.
>
